title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢
text:
EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî A Visual Analytics Prototype for Music Influence Exploration






The music industry lacks intuitive tools to visually trace influence, discover emerging talents, and understand genre diffusion. Existing dashboards are often statistical, but not exploratory or network-driven.



Using Mini-Challenge 1 (VAST 2025) data, we propose EchoScope ‚Äî a visual analytics tool to explore Sailor Shift‚Äôs influence and the rise of Oceanus Folk through interactive visualizations built with Shiny and network graphs.



To build this system, we analyzed:

17,000+ nodes representing artists, genres, producers, and songs

37,000+ edges including collaboration, stylistic influence, production, and genre classification

Key fields: notoriety_date, notable, InStyleOf, PerformerOf, genre






EchoScope‚Ñ¢ is a conceptual SaaS-like platform that combines:

Music knowledge graphs

Genre diffusion analysis

Artist influence scoring

It is designed to simulate a data product that helps:

üéß Music platforms discover new talents

üè∑Ô∏è Labels map influence networks

üìä Brands and analysts follow genre evolution


üéØ Vision: Use visual analytics + graph intelligence to discover the next ‚ÄúSailor Shift.‚Äù





We treat Mini-Challenge 1 as a real-world business question:

How can we analyze the career of Sailor Shift and uncover the influence of Oceanus Folk?

EchoScope addresses this through exploratory visual analytics features.














Module Name
Functionality
Business Value




üéº Influence Graph Studio
Builds 1‚Äì3 hop influence network from Sailor and others
Understand artist leverage and collaboration value


üî• Genre Diffusion Tracker
Tracks Oceanus Folk‚Äôs stylistic evolution and diffusion
Reveal cultural trends and genre crossovers


üöÄ Talent Score Engine
Predicts future breakout artists using graph and song metrics
Helps in signing, scouting, and artist incubation


üìä Trend Analytics Dashboard
Generates interactive genre/artist/time reports
Assists marketing, content, and PR strategies















Scenario
Role
Interaction Description




Talent Scouting
A&R Manager
Input genre ‚Üí Get Top 10 rising stars with influence score


Campaign Planning
Marketing
Filter by region + trend ‚Üí Identify target collaborations


Brand Matching
Brand Lead
Use graph to explore matching artist style


Catalog Curation
Music Editor
Track genre evolution to curate songs accordingly










Quarter
Goal




Q1
Build V1 prototype (Oceanus Folk + Sailor graph)


Q2
Add scoring model and timeline charts


Q3
Expand genres and add user customization options


Q4
Demo full use case with Shiny + deployment-ready site








Data Analytics: Graph modeling, centrality, genre signal detection

Shiny Prototyping: Frontend layout, visual rendering, interactivity


EchoScope is not just a course project ‚Äî it simulates how visual analytics can empower cultural discovery.









Home ‚Äì Project description, Sailor Shift bio, goal overview

Influence Graph ‚Äì Dynamic visNetwork with adjustable depth, filters by genre/year

Genre Diffusion ‚Äì Interactive timeline and genre flow chart

Talent Radar ‚Äì Artist radar chart based on scoring algorithm, download option

About ‚Äì Team roles, methodology, and reflection











Input Controls
Output Visualizations




Select Artist / Node
Interactive network (1‚Äì3 hop ego graph)


Choose Time Range
Timeline chart, genre progression map


Filter by Genre / Notability
Talent radar score & filtered influence list


Download Panel
Export PNG/PDF/CSV from each module























UI prototype for Genre Diffusion Tracker

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text: Discovering music influence and rising stars through interactive visual analytics

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text:
üéß Welcome to EchoScope‚Ñ¢
EchoScope‚Ñ¢ is a web-based visual analytics prototype built for the ISSS608 Visual Analytics course project. It uses VAST 2025 Mini-Challenge 1 data to explore the artistic evolution of Sailor Shift and the influence of Oceanus Folk on global music.
Our dashboard simulates a modern SaaS platform, offering interactive graphs and dashboards similar in experience to Apple Music, allowing music analysts, A&R managers, and cultural researchers to explore trends and talent.

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text:
üîç Project Goals

Trace influence paths of iconic artists
Analyze the genre evolution of Oceanus Folk
Predict rising stars based on data and influence scores
Demonstrate how network science and visual analytics can support cultural insight

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text:
üìÇ Case Data Sample

17,000+ nodes: artists, genres, songs, producers
37,000+ edges: performer links, stylistic influence, collaborations
Key attributes: notoriety_date, PerformerOf, InStyleOf, genre, notable

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text:
üß© Functional Modules







Module Name
Functionality




üéº Influence Graph
Explore Sailor‚Äôs direct and indirect connections (1‚Äì3 hops)


üî• Genre Diffusion
Visualize timeline trends of Oceanus Folk across decades


üöÄ Talent Radar
Identify breakout artists via composite scoring


üìä Trend Dashboard
Analyze stylistic output by genre, artist, and time

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text:
üí° Explore the Dashboard
Click the tabs in the navigation bar to interact with each module:

Influence Graph ‚Äì Dynamic visNetwork graph of Sailor Shift‚Äôs artistic web
Genre Diffusion ‚Äì Area chart + stacked plot of evolving genres
Talent Radar ‚Äì Radar comparison of rising artists
About ‚Äì Methodology, team, and acknowledgments

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
EchoScope‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Discovering Music Influence Through Visual Analytics
text:
üë®‚Äçüéì Built With

Quarto + Shiny
networkx, visNetwork, plotly, echarts4r
Designed with an Apple Music-inspired aesthetic


¬© 2025 EchoScope Project ‚Äî Created for academic purposes under SMU ISSS608

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢ Prototype Storyboard
text:
EchoScope‚Ñ¢ is a visual analytics prototype designed to analyze artist influence, genre diffusion, and talent discovery through interactive dashboards and knowledge graph exploration.




This section illustrates the main user interaction journey through the EchoScope‚Ñ¢ platform.

Flow Structure: 1. Home ‚Äì Introduction and orientation
2. Influence Analysis ‚Äì Explore influence networks
3. Genre Diffusion ‚Äì Track genre trends over time
4. Talent Radar ‚Äì Compare and discover emerging talent
5. Trend Dashboard ‚Äì Export macro-level insights
üìå [Insert user flow diagram or screenshot here]
![User Flow Diagram](images/user_flow_placeholder.png){width=100%}






Welcome users and introduce the EchoScope‚Ñ¢ platform.



Simple homepage with a welcome message and orientation notes.
üì∏ [Insert screenshot of Home Panel]
![Home Panel Screenshot](images/home_panel_placeholder.png){width=100%}


Show code

tabItem(
  tabName = "home",
  fluidRow(
    box(
      width = 12, status = "primary", solidHeader = FALSE,
      HTML('<h1>Welcome!</h1><p>EchoScope‚Ñ¢ is a web-based visual analytics prototype...</p>')
    )
  )
)

üîó Influence Analysis Panel
Purpose Visualize and filter artist influence relationships based on node/edge types, year range, and depth.

Key Features Filter by node type (Artist, Album, Song)
Choose edge types (Performer, Producer, Collaborator)
Control release year and depth (e.g., 1-hop, 2-hop)

üì∏ [Insert screenshot of Influence Graph Panel] 


Show code

tabItem(
  tabName = "influenced",
  fluidRow(
    column(4, wellPanel(
      pickerInput("node_type", "Select Node Type", choices = ...),
      pickerInput("edge_type", "Select Edge Type", ...),
      sliderInput("release_range", "Release Year Range", ...),
      sliderInput("network_depth", "Network Depth", ...)
    )),
    column(8, visNetworkOutput("directGraph", height = "700px"))
  )
)

üìà Genre Diffusion Panel
Purpose Track the evolution of music genres across time using visual summaries.

Key Features Select and compare genres
View stacked area charts or yearly heatmaps

üì∏ [Insert screenshot of Genre Diffusion Panel] 


Show code

tabItem(
  tabName = "genre",
  fluidRow(
    column(4,
      pickerInput("trend_genre", "Select Genre(s)", ...),
      dateRangeInput("trend_year_range", "Year Range", ...)
    ),
    column(8,
      tabsetPanel(
        tabPanel("Stacked Area Chart", plotlyOutput("trend_area_plot")),
        tabPanel("Yearly Heatmap", plotlyOutput("trend_heatmap"))
      )
    )
  )
)

üöÄ Talent Radar Panel Purpose
Compare emerging artists based on graph features and scoring metrics to identify rising talent in a specific genre.
Key Features üéØ Filter by Genre Users can focus on a specific musical style to narrow the artist pool.

üéõ Customizable Score Weights Sliders allow users to adjust the importance of PageRank, Degree Centrality, Style Similarity, and Notable Works ‚Äî helping tailor the talent score to different discovery goals.
üìä Radar Comparison Chart Visually compare up to 5 artists across the 4 scoring dimensions using an interactive radar plot.
üìã Scoreboard Table A sortable, downloadable table summarizing talent scores and ranking details.
üì• Export Results Allows users to download the scoring results as a CSV for further analysis or reporting.

üì∏ [Insert screenshot of Talent Radar Panel] 




Show code

Copy
Edit
tabItem(
  tabName = "talent",
  fluidRow(
    column(4,
      pickerInput("talent_genre", "Filter by Genre", ...),
      uiOutput("select_compare_artists"),
      sliderInput("weight_pagerank", "PageRank", 0, 1, 0.3),
      sliderInput("weight_degree", "Degree Centrality", 0, 1, 0.2),
      sliderInput("weight_similarity", "Style Similarity", 0, 1, 0.3),
      sliderInput("weight_notable_count", "Notable Works Count", 0, 1, 0.2),
      downloadButton("download_weighted_scores", "Download CSV")
    ),
    column(8,
      tabsetPanel(
        tabPanel("Radar Comparison", plotlyOutput("talent_radar_plot")),
        tabPanel("Scoreboard", DTOutput("talent_score_table"))
      )
    )
  )
)

üìä Trend Dashboard Panel
Purpose Enable high-level insights export and macro filtering across all trends.

Key Features Select multiple genres
Choose analysis layers (e.g., cumulative, normalized)
Export raw data as CSV

üì∏ [Insert screenshot of Trend Dashboard Panel] 


Show code

tabItem(
  tabName = "trend",
  fluidRow(
    column(4,
      pickerInput("trend_genre", "Select Genre(s)", ...),
      checkboxGroupInput("trend_layers", "Show Layers", choices = ...),
      downloadButton("download_trend_data", "Export Trend Data")
    ),
    column(8, plotlyOutput("trend_area_plot"))
  )
)

title: EchoScope‚Ñ¢
text:
Project Schedule
Below is an overview of our project timeline.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)

# ‰ªªÂä°ÊéíÊúü
schedule_df <- tibble(
  task = c(
    "Proposal Brainstorming", "Proposal Editing & Publishing",
    "R Quarto / Netlify Setup", "R Shiny App Development",
    "User Guide Drafting", "Poster Design", "Poster Uploading",
    "Poster Presentation", "Final Submission"
  ),
  start = as.Date(c(
    "2025-06-01", "2025-06-05", "2025-06-09", "2025-06-18",
    "2025-06-22", "2025-06-10", "2025-06-25", "2025-07-02", "2025-06-28"
  )),
  end = as.Date(c(
    "2025-06-04", "2025-06-08", "2025-06-14", "2025-06-27",
    "2025-06-30", "2025-06-24", "2025-06-26", "2025-07-02", "2025-07-06"
  )),
  category = c(
    "Proposal", "Proposal", "Development", "Development",
    "Documentation", "Poster", "Poster", "Presentation", "Submission"
  )
)

# ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÊó•Êúü
due_dates <- tibble(
  label = c("Due 8 Jun", "Due 26 Jun", "Due 2 Jul", "Due 6 Jul"),
  date = as.Date(c("2025-06-08", "2025-06-26", "2025-07-02", "2025-07-06"))
)

# Êó•ÊúüÊ†áÊ≥®È¢ùÂ§ñÂ≠óÊÆµÔºàÂ±ïÁ§∫ÂÆåÊï¥Êó•ÊúüÔºâ
due_dates <- due_dates %>%
  mutate(date_str = format(date, "%b %d"))

# È¢úËâ≤
colors <- c(
  "Proposal" = "#1b9e77", "Development" = "#d95f02", "Documentation" = "#7570b3",
  "Poster" = "#e7298a", "Presentation" = "#66a61e", "Submission" = "#e6ab02"
)

max_y <- length(unique(schedule_df$task)) + 1

# ÁªòÂõæ
ggplot(schedule_df, aes(x = start, xend = end, y = task, yend = task, color = category)) +
  geom_segment(size = 6, lineend = "round") +
  geom_vline(data = due_dates, aes(xintercept = date), color = "red", linetype = "dashed") +
  geom_text(
    data = due_dates,
    mapping = aes(x = date, label = paste(label, "\n", date_str)),
    y = max_y,
    inherit.aes = FALSE,
    color = "red", size = 3.5, vjust = 0
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(values = colors) +
  labs(title = "EchoScope Project Timeline", x = "Date", y = "Task") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    legend.position = "right",
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold")
  )
